entity1.name: Renaissance
entity1.description: A period in European history from the 14th to the 17th century, marked by a revival of interest in ancient Greek and Roman culture, which saw significant developments in art, science, and literature.;;;An era of European history from the 14th to the 17th century, marked by a revival of interest in the arts and sciences.
entity1.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces5;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces3

entity2.name: modern art
entity2.description: A broad movement that refers to artistic works produced during the period extending roughly from the 1860s to the 1970s, characterized by a departure from traditional techniques and styles.

entity3.name: Leonardo da Vinci
entity3.description: Leonardo da Vinci, an Italian polymath whose areas of interest included invention, painting, sculpting, architecture, science, music, mathematics, engineering, literature, anatomy, geology, astronomy, botany, writing, history, and cartography.;;;Italian polymath of the Renaissance era, renowned as a painter, inventor, and scientist.;;;A famous Italian artist, inventor, and polymath of the Renaissance era.
entity3.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces5;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces4;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces7

entity4.name: Mona Lisa
entity4.description: A famous 16th-century portrait painted by Leonardo da Vinci, known for its enigmatic smile and the subject's gaze.;;;A famous portrait painted by Leonardo da Vinci in the early 16th century, known for its enigmatic smile and detailed technique.;;;An iconic painting by Leonardo da Vinci, known for its enigmatic smile and detailed portrayal.;;;A famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci, known for its enigmatic smile and the subject's gaze.
entity4.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces5;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces26;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces4;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces7

entity8.name: The enigmatic smile of the subject
entity8.description: A distinctive facial expression in a famous painting that has intrigued viewers for centuries.

entity9.name: one of the most recognizable paintings
entity9.description: Refers to a highly renowned and widely recognized piece of art, likely the Mona Lisa by Leonardo da Vinci.

entity12.name: Renaissance man
entity12.description: A term used to describe a person who is well educated or has abilities in a wide variety of fields, especially during the Renaissance period.

entity13.name: Michelangelo
entity13.description: Italian sculptor, painter, architect, and poet of the High Renaissance, known for his works such as the frescoes on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel.;;;A famous Italian Renaissance artist known for his work in sculpture, painting, and architecture.
entity13.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces9;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces7

entity14.name: Sistine Chapel
entity14.description: The ceiling of the Sistine Chapel, a renowned fresco cycle painted by Michelangelo in Vatican City.;;;A chapel in the Vatican City, famous for its frescoed ceiling painted by Michelangelo, which depicts scenes from the Bible.
entity14.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces9;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces7

entity15.name: The ceiling
entity15.description: A significant piece of art located in a prominent place, often painted or decorated with intricate designs.

entity16.name: Bible
entity16.description: The holy book of Christianity, containing the Old and New Testaments.

entity17.name: Creation of Adam
entity17.description: A famous fresco by Michelangelo, depicting God reaching out to touch Adam, located on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel.

entity18.name: Last Judgment
entity18.description: A large fresco by Michelangelo, illustrating the second coming of Christ and the final judgment of all souls, located on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel.

entity21.name: Vatican
entity21.description: A city-state in Rome, Italy, and the headquarters of the Roman Catholic Church.

entity22.name: Baroque period
entity22.description: A major period in the history of Western art, spanning from the early 17th century to the mid-18th century, characterized by ornate details and dramatic use of light and shadow.

entity23.name: Caravaggio
entity23.description: An Italian painter active in Rome, Naples, Malta, and Sicily from the early 1590s to his death. He is known for his dramatic use of light and shadow.;;;An Italian painter active during the Baroque period, renowned for his realistic observation of the human state, both physical and emotional, and his dramatic use of light and shadow.;;;An Italian painter active in the late 16th and early 17th centuries, known for his dramatic use of light and shadow and intense realism.
entity23.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces11;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces12;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces14

entity25.name: The Calling of Saint Matthew
entity25.description: A famous painting depicting the moment when Jesus calls Matthew to become one of his disciples.

entity26.name: Jesus
entity26.description: The central figure in Christianity, believed by Christians to be the Son of God and the Messiah prophesied in the Old Testament.

entity27.name: Matthew
entity27.description: One of the twelve apostles of Jesus and traditionally considered the author of the first Gospel in the New Testament.

entity29.name: Impressionists
entity29.description: An art movement characterized by loose brushwork and vibrant colors, aiming to capture the effect of light and atmosphere.;;;An art movement characterized by visible brush strokes, open composition, emphasis on accurate depiction of light in its changing qualities, ordinary subject matter, inclusion of movement as a crucial element of human perception and experience, and unusual visual angles.;;;A group of artists in the 19th century who focused on capturing the transient effects of light and color.
entity29.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces15;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces17;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces16

entity30.name: 19th century
entity30.description: The period from 1801 to 1900, during which significant changes occurred in art, science, and society.

entity31.name: Claude Monet
entity31.description: A famous French painter known for his work in the Impressionist movement.;;;A famous French Impressionist painter known for his series of paintings of water lilies and gardens.
entity31.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces17;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces16

entity33.name: Giverny
entity33.description: A commune in the Normandy region of northern France where Claude Monet lived and painted many of his famous works, including the water lily series.

entity36.name: Pablo Picasso
entity36.description: Pablo Picasso, a Spanish painter and sculptor who co-founded the Cubist movement and is one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.;;;Spanish painter and sculptor, one of the most influential artists of the 20th century, co-founder of Cubism.;;;A Spanish painter and sculptor, known as a pioneer of Cubism.;;;A Spanish painter and sculptor, one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.;;;A renowned Spanish artist and sculptor, known for co-founding the Cubist movement and contributing significantly to abstract art.
entity36.chunkid: Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces26;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces21;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces20;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces18;;;Famous Artists and Their Masterpieces19

entity37.name: 20th century
entity37.description: The period from 1901 to 2000, characterized by significant technological and social changes.

entity39.name: Cubism
entity39.description: A revolutionary art movement that sought to depict objects from multiple viewpoints simultaneously.

entity40.name: Les Demoiselles d'Avignon
entity40.description: A painting by Pablo Picasso, known for its groundbreaking approach to perspective and representation.

entity43.name: abstract art
entity43.description: An artistic style that departs from representational accuracy to use shapes, colors, forms, and gestural marks to achieve its effect.

entity44.name: Vincent van Gogh
entity44.description: A Dutch post-impressionist painter known for his emotionally charged landscapes and influential works of art.

entity45.name: Frida Kahlo
entity45.description: A Mexican artist renowned for her powerful self-portraits that often reflect her personal experiences and pain.

entity46.name: famous artists
entity46.description: A collective term for well-known individuals who create visual art.

entity47.name: masterpieces
entity47.description: Outstanding works of art created by famous artists, often considered the pinnacle of their creative achievements.

entity48.name: art history
entity48.description: The academic discipline that studies the development and significance of visual arts throughout human history.
